editorial_summary.overview: Panoramic views of up to 40 miles with a good visibility guarantee (or you visit again for free).

reviews.text:
The View from The Shard is one of a kind and breathtaking. A full 360 view of London, the tallest building with a viewing platform.

The shard also has three restaurants in it that you can RSVP. I highly recommend it.

Even if you’re not down to eat at any of the restaurants at the very top You can RSVP a small table and get cocktails, snacks, desserts, pastries, and more.

In the evening they will also have performance artist like a singer or pianist.

My boyfriend and I stayed up there for a few hours. Just enjoying the lovely view, this is a must see attractions in London.

reviews.author_name: Kat K I K T A
reviews.text:
Beautiful views, great architecture etc, but the overall experience has been below our expectations on numerous visits.
It seems they made the venue as uncomfortable as possible, so they are able to have a quick turnaround of people.
The bar at the very top has an open roof (so it gets chilly), yet they only sell cold drinks (also in the middle of the winter) and on the top of that- their drink selection is VERY limited.
If they put some thought and creativity into it, they’d be serving warm drinks- mulled wines, mulled cider, teas, coffees and all sorts of alcoholic as well as non alcoholic drinks, but instead- you can only buy cold drinks, yet you have nowhere to sit and actually enjoy your drink and the view…
The lower bar does serve warm drinks as well as cocktails, etc., but the queues are so long, the place is overcrowded, all seats are always taken (unless you come on a quiet day/morning) and there are always some visitors playing piano (not very well), so the whole atmosphere is rather unpleasant. It feels like some cheap (even though the prices are high) tourist trap.
We got our coffees from the lower bar, walked up the flights of stairs and drunk our coffees in the bar at the top, but again- with nowhere to sit it just doesn’t feel like it’s a very welcoming place, which is such a shame and a missed opportunity in my opinion.
It’d have been so beautiful if they had some decent mixed drinks/cocktails and perhaps warm cocktails, mead, hot cider upstairs… also some half decent music… but it seems it’s much more important for them to get a high volume of people in and out, fast ;)

The View from The Shard in London is simply breathtaking. As you ascend the towering structure, the city unfolds beneath you, revealing iconic landmarks like the Tower Bridge, the Thames River, and the sprawling cityscape. The panorama was stunning during sunset, casting a warm glow over the urban landscape.It offers a unique and unforgettable perspective of London, making it a must-visit for anyone seeking a remarkable city view.
Extremely beautiful view. Very remarkable tower. Not cheap but for me it was worth every penny.  I would love to have a tour through the whole building.....
Absolutely loved this experience. £32 per person when we went up. Staff were excellent though. Views when the weather cleared a bit were amazing.

address: 32 London Bridge St, London SE1 9SG, United Kingdom
